intro: Couepia ulei, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white or yellowish flowers. The plant produces fruit that is typically a capsule containing numerous seeds. It is often found in forest understories and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
